channel.title: RSM > 3DS in C++
channel.description:
Ripped directly from my post at r-s:
After seeing the faggotry that people are using to get models into 3ds max (I cant find the exact thread.), I decided to write my own converter to make things a little easier. So far it only supports the conversion from rsm to 3ds, but i'm working on reversing the process right now. [IMG]http://www.nuke-net.com/screenshots/3-2-2010_20541.png[/img]
rs23ds.exe is a command line only app (That means you'll have to use command prompt to execute it) Use as: rs23ds.exe input.rsm output.3ds (note input.rsm can be named .dat, .mdl, whatever, its all the same format.)
However, I've written a nice little GUI for you to batch convert and such. [IMG]http://www.nuke-net.com/screenshots/4-2-2010_194746.png[/img]
Download UI at: [url=http://drop.io/rs23dsconv]http://drop.io/rs23dsconv[/url]
A release: [url=http://uppit.com/v/N8WTQKEU]http://uppit.com/v/N8WTQKEU[/url] And the SVN: [url=http://svn.nuke-net.com/rs23ds/Rs23DS/]http://svn.nuke-net.com/rs23ds/Rs23DS/[/url] (Code isn't perfect, It works.)

item.title: RSM > 3DS in C++
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Texture support?
it’s fairly easy
if you want the code ask, you should already have it though.

Read full topic

item.title: RSM > 3DS in C++
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Lookin’ good tom.

But whats the use in this? When it doesn’t even support the animation file?

Read full topic

item.title: RSM > 3DS in C++
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“AuraDevil, post:5, topic:328273”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=424665.msg3118922#msg3118922 date=1265326372]

I don’t suppose this keeps the animation data?

No, the 3ds format doesn’t properly support vertex skinning. I’ll probably work on converting to FBX format instead (which will properly support animation)

That would be pretty awesome.

Good job on this, will probably use at one point or another, although, there aren’t a lot of 3ds max users here besides me and someone else.
[/quote]
I believe (from the 10 minutes or so i read up on it <3) FBX is a fairly common format. I know Maya has importers for the format.[/quote]

Ahh, that’s good then, never really done a lot of animation myself, only extreme metasequoia skinning.

Read full topic

item.title: RSM > 3DS in C++
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:4, topic:328273”][quote author=AuraDevil link=topic=424665.msg3118911#msg3118911 date=1265324799]

I don’t suppose this keeps the animation data?

No, the 3ds format doesn’t properly support vertex skinning. I’ll probably work on converting to FBX format instead (which will properly support animation)
[/quote]

That would be pretty awesome.

Good job on this, will probably use at one point or another, although, there aren’t a lot of 3ds max users here besides me and someone else. :|[/quote]
I believe (from the 10 minutes or so i read up on it <3) FBX is a fairly common format. I know Maya has importers for the format.

Read full topic

item.title: RSM > 3DS in C++
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“AuraDevil, post:3, topic:328273”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=424665.msg3118906#msg3118906 date=1265324359]
I don’t suppose this keeps the animation data?
[/quote]
No, the 3ds format doesn’t properly support vertex skinning. I’ll probably work on converting to FBX format instead (which will properly support animation)[/quote]

That would be pretty awesome.

Good job on this, will probably use at one point or another, although, there aren’t a lot of 3ds max users here besides me and someone else.

Read full topic

Ripped directly from my post at r-s:

After seeing the faggotry that people are using to get models into 3ds max (I cant find the exact thread.), I decided to write my own converter to make things a little easier.
So far it only supports the conversion from rsm to 3ds, but i’m working on reversing the process right now.

rs23ds.exe is a command line only app (That means you’ll have to use command prompt to execute it)
Use as: rs23ds.exe input.rsm output.3ds
(note input.rsm can be named .dat, .mdl, whatever, its all the same format.)
